intro: Bunchosia hypoleuca, commonly known as the white-flowered burr bush, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, spiny foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by velvety, triangular-shaped fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dry, disturbed soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
